text: Howdy folks, anyone know how to get social urls from site settings with hubl? :slightly_smiling_face:

Hi <@UATE4ATHP> I apologize for the late response, I was out of office yesterday. Would you mind DM'ing me the image URL you are working with which is failing to re-size? Additionally, can you DM me the page on which you have the image inserted?

yep, go into your portal and find the default follow Me module.

you can clone that and in there you’ll see how it’s retrieving those URLs

hey quick menu related question. Where do I find the `menu_id`?

*More context*
- I’m trying to extract some of these values: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/hubl-supported-variables>
- According to the menu function I need the _“ID of the advanced menu”_: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/en/docs/hubl/hubl-supported-functions#menu>
- This page says I need to find it under `Content Settings > Advanced Menus`: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/hubl-supported-tags#menu>
- Where are the content settings? Well I can’t see that mentioned in the interface. Even when you navigate to <http://app.HubSpot.com/settings|app.HubSpot.com/settings> it doesn’t mention “content settings” anywhere.
- I did some searching and found this post announcing the new content settings: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/blog/new-content-settings>
- That wasn’t much help because it didn’t mention “content settings” anywhere in those screenshots either. In fact that article announces a new advanced menu update….

Did menu_id get removed from an old “Content Settings” page that used to have a different “Advanced Menus” design? This is pretty confusing!
<@UGXN90PAP> You mentioned giving docs feedback in another one of my threads, maybe this could be improved? :slightly_smiling_face:
to add to this. Here is what the menu options look like

Hey <@UPB0U0V38>, that description is out of date (cc: <@U7SL518D6>/<@U2H3TT8F2>) but you're in the right place! The number in the URL,~ in between `menus/` and `/edit`~ after `/edit/`, is the menu id.
Zog beat me to it.
that’s what I thought! I’ve tried that too
as you can see that matches the url in my first screenshot
that code snippet is the example one in the second link I shared
Click the default menu link in that dropdown. I realize youre on it already but it might make the id appear in the URL.
What you used in the menu function appears to be your portal id
Sorry on my phone otherwise id show screenshots
all good. So when you click on the menu under in the dropdown my url changes to `<https://app.HubSpot.com/menus/6567196/edit/18134349438>`
Ah, yes, my bad <@UPB0U0V38>. Updated my previous comment- will note that it doesn't show up at first, which is annoying.
Its the number after /edit/
worked!
Good to see I’m not crazy. I’ve been putting this part off for a while because it made no sense to me lol
If you're building a custom module you can actually just use a menu field to make it selectable. Then you dont need to look in the url at all. Thats the most common use. Menu field outputs menu id
Can I get the same raw menu data that way? The whole reason I’m doing this is so that I can create my own menu without having to tear apart the default menu markup with jquery
Yes. The menu field if you do "copy value only" gives you just the id which you can put in the menu function
I see
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/code-gallery/entry/founders/TheWebTech-Basic-Menu-using-Menu-Function?hsLang=en>
Theres an example of how you can use it
You're right the menu function documentation can use some attention. We dont want to lose the menu_id part though as that would obfuscate how it works but showing it in a module context is important.
agreed. those “steps on how to create the field” could outline it perhaps.
either way, any extra info would be an improvement!
Thanks again for your help! I’ve been able to make a nice menu system of my own :slightly_smiling_face:
if anyone is curious about using <http://bulma.io|bulma.io> check this out
